gaia::text::TransformationMethod Class Reference

TextView uses TransformationMethods to do things like replacing the characters of passwords with dots, or keeping the newline characters from causing line breaks in single-line text fields. More...

Detailed Description

TextView uses TransformationMethods to do things like replacing the characters of passwords with dots, or keeping the newline characters from causing line breaks in single-line text fields.

See also:
SingleLineTransformationMethod, PasswordTransformationMethod

Definition at line 30 of file TransformationMethod.h.

Member Function Documentation

gaia::text::TransformationMethod::DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN ( TransformationMethod  ) [private]
virtual base::CharSequence* gaia::text::TransformationMethod::getTransformation ( const base::CharSequence *  source,
const core::Widget *  view 
) [pure virtual]

Returns a CharSequence that is a transformation of the source text -- for example, replacing each character with a dot in a password field.

Beware that the returned text must be exactly the same length as the source text, and that if the source text is Editable, the returned text must mirror it dynamically instead of doing a one-time copy.

Implemented in gaia::text::PasswordTransformationMethod, and gaia::text::ReplacementTransformationMethod.

virtual void gaia::text::TransformationMethod::onFocusChanged ( const core::Widget *  view,
const base::CharSequence *  sourceText,
bool  focused,
int32_t  direction,
const graphics::Rect *  previouslyFocusedRect 
) [pure virtual]

This method is called when the TextView that uses this TransformationMethod gains or loses focus.

Implemented in gaia::text::PasswordTransformationMethod, and gaia::text::ReplacementTransformationMethod.
